other_tests.findings: At birth, serum adjusted-calcium was 2.11 mmol/L (8.44 mg/dL); at readmission (7 days of age), serum adjusted-calcium was 1.57 mmol/L (6.28 mg/dL), indicating hypocalcemia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Over the next 48 hours, serum calcium concentration increased into the normal range.

other_tests.findings: Elevated serum phosphate of 3.45 mmol/L (10.7 mg/dL); normal range is 1.30 - 2.60 mmol/L (4.0 - 8.0 mg/dL).
Inappropriately normal serum PTH of 2.2 pmol/L; normal range is 1.0 - 9.3 pmol/L.
Borderline low serum magnesium at 0.62 mmol/L (1.5 mg/dL); normal range is 0.62 - 1.00 mmol/L (1.5 - 2.4 mg/dL).

other_tests.changes_over_time: Treatment resulted in a rapid improvement in serum calcium levels.

other_tests.findings: Administered to address vitamin D deficiency.
